data.title: te
data.body:
It's sound look like can set environment variables by "terminal.integrated.env.windows" config

- VSCode Version: 1.16.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. File > Preference > Setting, save with below text
{
    "terminal.integrated.env.windows": {
        "foo": "bar"
    }
}

2. View > Integrated Terminal

3. input echo $foo in Terminal

Output:
Windows PowerShell
Copyright (C) 2016 Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

PS C:\bar> echo $foo
PS C:\bar> 

Expected Output:
Windows PowerShell
Copyright (C) 2016 Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

PS C:\bar> echo $foo
bar       <---- because configed in terminal.integrated.env.windows
PS C:\bar> 

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Extensions break Intellisence in large multi-project folders (64bit version, TypeScript 2.5)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.1 (27492b6bf3acb0775d82d2f87rb25a93490673c6d, 2017-09-14T16:38:23.027Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
regex|chr|0.1.0
vscode-generate-getter-setter|DSK|0.4.2
tslint|eg2|1.0.6
prettier-vscode|esb|0.23.1
code-runner|for|0.7.1
vscode-react-typescript|inf|1.0.8
docthis|joe|0.4.8
PowerShell|ms-|1.4.3
typescript-javascript-grammar|ms-|0.0.23
javascript-typescript|sou|0.0.4
code-spell-checker|str|1.3.9
comment-snippets|Tob|0.2.0

IntelliSense and type navigation for both basic type (e.g. Array, Number, String) and project specific types (interface Foo1) simply doesn't work in large projects.
This is especially apparent in multi-project folders .
We use rush (https://github.com/Microsoft/web-build-tools/blob/master/apps/rush/README.md) to manage a large repo with multiple projects.
If I open code on a single projects IntelliSense and type navigation works, however if I open in the root both operations becomes so slow they are virtually broken.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: No

data.title: problemMatcher $tsc-watch ignores error second time around
Provide an API to resolve a ThemeColor into its real color
data.body:
AFAIK, there isn't any way to resolve a ThemeColor into its real css value. This would probably be useful in quite a few scenarios, but here's what I'm trying to do.

In the image below, I am adding an icon in the top right (link icon) to the hover, but because I have no controls for light vs dark, it is hard to get it to be visible. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/641685/30459148-e18724a0-997c-11e7-875b-396ffa6aa3d2.png)

What I'd like to do is actually use one of the theme colors (aside -- even though it is an svg I couldn't get any css color inheritance to work, neither as a file nor data-uri). So if there was a way to get the real color for a `ThemeColor`, I could build an svg document with the proper color and embed it into a data-uri.

data.title: vscode.diff only allows selecting language for right-hand diff
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.17.0-insider commit 06529dbcacb796d59e7fc2ca0ac5dbe7c29c099e
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro v1703

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Right-click a plaintext file and select 'select for compare'
2. Right-click another plaintext file and select 'compare with ...'
(The language in the bottom-right should be "Plain Text")
3. Click "Plain Text" and select another language
You will see syntax highlighting for the right-hand diff, but the left-hand diff remains plain text

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12286274/30458841-98ef5044-996a-11e7-8f88-ecf9defd9fbf.png)

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: [macOS] editor.autoClosingBrackets not working with "U.S. International - PC"

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.0 (787b31c0474e6165390b5a5989c9619e3e16f953, 2017-09-06T16:12:42.401Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-eslint|dba|1.3.1
pgsql|dou|0.0.8
toggle-excluded-files|eam|1.6.0
prettier-vscode|esb|0.23.1
auto-close-tag|for|0.5.0
auto-rename-tag|for|0.0.14

(1 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Switch the keyboard layout to "U.S. International - PC" on the Mac. System Preferences > Keyboard > Input Sources > Add they layout and enable it (e.g. via US Flag in the task bar, next to the clock).
2. In Visual Studio Code, make sure the setting "editor.autoClosingBrackets" is set to true.
3. Try to use auto completion with single or double quotes => it's not working, only 1 character appears.
4. Switch the keyboard layout to "U.S.". Add again a double or single quote => VS Code auto-completes the input with a second character.

See also video: https://imgur.com/a/Wpm7w
Note: 
- The different color of the single quote for U.S. International. That's to create special chars, e.g. é or ë for double quotes. To just write the double or single quote character, hit space afterwards. 
- Braces always work.


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Uninstall of a dependent extension silently fails
data.body:
MacOS
Insiders or Stable

Install an extension pack
Try to uninstall one of the dependent extensions

Result: You are asked if you want to uninstall the extension, you say OK, but the extension is not uninstalled.

In this gif, the Azure Account extension is a dependency of the App Service extension.  When I try to uninstall I'm prompted, but nothing happens.

![uninstalldep](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1487073/30457085-f6960c16-995a-11e7-81cc-d9879ecc7378.gif)

I would expect a prompt that says "This extension cannot be uninstalled because other extensions are dependent upon it. Please uninstall the other extensions first." 

Even better, there is some way to see the list of extensions that are dependent upon the extension, like we have a "Dependencies" tab for an extension, perhaps we have a "Dependents" tab.

data.title: Prompting to install an extension after uninstalling extension

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
MacOS
Stable 1.16.0

Related to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/33030#issuecomment-328021592

Open Chrome
browse to Marketplace.visualstudio.com
pick an extension, any extension
click on the "Install" button 
VS code should start (I have another issue to log were VS Code will not start...)
Click "Install" on the prompt to install the extension
Click on "Reload"
Uninstall the extension
Click on "Reload"

Result: You are prompted to install the extension again!

Click "Cancel"
F1 and then "Reload Window"

Result: You are prompted again to install the extension

![installbug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1487073/30456058-fc4924d0-9956-11e7-92e1-4bd6228c415d.gif)

2. Create simple project with gradle, start writing a file

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->

I think this is an issue with many plugins that have several issues. One could say hey - just fix the plugins, write issue there, but I think it's ok for some plugin to show errors in output. I think there can be a feature, option in settings which would disallow forceful pop up of this panel, instead showing small alert icon for developer to see later or whenever he/she wants.
Thanks!

data.title: Maintain focus on stopped thread when stepping a multithreaded session
data.body:
### What does this PR do?
There are a couple of issues with multithreaded debugging. When a second thread gets the first stopped event, the UI does not autofocus to that thread. When the user steps the second thread, the UI switches focus to the first thread.

![before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7286437/30454245-84280274-9950-11e7-8cf5-26fceed487f9.gif)

The proposed fix is to allow focus if the currently focused thread is different than the one that wants to be focused on. Also, only auto-focus to the first thread if there's only one thread.

![after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7286437/30454310-b2c3abc4-9950-11e7-9e77-eda6e27a6e56.gif)


#### What issues does this PR fix?
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/34246

data.title: Pasted text is truncated at the first null char

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.0 (787b31c0474e6165390b5a5989c9619e3e16f953, 2017-09-06T16:27:49.891Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
code-gnu-global|aus|0.2.2
xml|Dot|1.9.2
json-tools|eri|1.0.2
cpptools|ms-|0.12.4
csharp|ms-|1.12.1
prettify-selected-json|vth|1.0.3
---
When pasting text that contains null characters, the pasted text will be truncated at the first null character. Notably, copying text from within vscode and pasting it in-place will change the text that was selected if it contains nulls.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Copy text to your clipboard containing null characters
2. Paste into a vscode window

Expected behaviour: the entire string copied to the clipboard is pasted.

Actual behaviour: the pasted string is truncated before the first null character.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: "Everyday" typo
data.body:
"Everyday" can mean "ordinary" or other synonyms. 

"Every day" means "each day", which is how it is being used in the relevant sentence.

data.title: DateTime is no more localized (in extension)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.16 /1.17 insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

In my extension (local-history), I use date.toLocaleString()
Previous return : 17/07/2016 à 10:12:25  (not sure it was in last version, perhaps a previous one...)
Currently return : 2016-7-17 10:12:25

In the console (Help / Toggle Developer Tools), I can still see  "17/07/2016 à 10:12:25"

data.title: Transform tips to links or buttons?
data.body:
When no editor is open there's an area in the middle of the screen with some commands and hotkeys:

![no-editor](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9638156/30444998-6260f6cc-998d-11e7-89c8-4166c3532363.png)


I expected them to trigger actions on click but that didn't happen. Was it done to promote hotkeys (intentionally) or not?

It just so happens "Welcome page" has both (links and buttons) that invoke commands written on them.

I have a windows 7 64bit PC running on an AMD processor with on board NVIDIA graphics chipset and 8 gb of RAM. I have tried various versions of vs code but the result is the same. It freezes the system for about 2 minutes until it opens it with a 100% CPU usage.

I have also tried different options like disable GPU and running without extentions etc. but all in vain.

I have an older laptop with 1gig RAM and windows 7 32 bit where vs code 1.1 runs without any of the above issues smoothly.

Can you please help ?

- OS Version: Windows 7 Ultimate 64bit

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open visual studio code
2. System freeze and 100% CPU

> I've only noticed this happening today, so I'm not sure if the latest VSCode update has introduced this bug (I'm running 1.14.0).
